personalInfo.family: Wife: Ana Yilsen Mondragón; Sons (3), Donovan (1998), Paul (2000) and Seef (2008).

tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Opened the year with a victory at the Developmental Series Final in Ecuador to earn full exempt status on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica… Had one top-25 and two cuts made in eight starts to finish the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season ranked 138th on the Order of Merit… Lone top-25 was T23 at the Volvo Colombian Classic in September… Closed the year with a T9 finish at the Developmental Series Final in Ecuador to claim back Latinoamérica Tour status.

2014: Played three events on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica and finished T55 on both of the cuts he made… Won twice on the Colombian Tour, first at the Abierto del Carmel Club, his home club in Bogota, and later at the Abierto del Club Farallones in Cali.

2013: Earned back his PGA TOUR Latinoamérica with a T13 at the Lima, Peru Q-School in February… Had three cuts made in eight starts on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica, with a T28 at the Arturo Calle Colombian Classic in November as his best finish. Closed the year ranked 129th on the Order of Merit… Won the XXX Abierto del Carmel Club on the Colombian Tour at the end of February.

2012: Had the distinction of hitting the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica's first shot when he hit a drive off the first tee on Sept. 5 at the Mundo Maya Open at El Jaguar GC at Yucatan CC. Shot an opening-round 71 and went on to T34… Made the cut in five of nine starts, with a T31 finish at the Dominican Republic Open as his best finish. Made a hole-in-one during the final round of that event when he hit a pitching wedge from 143-yards at the par-three No. 13… Closed the year ranked 85th on the Order of Merit.

2011: After sharing medalist honors at the Tour de las Americas Q-School, he went on to have a couple of top-5s, solo fourth at the 53rd Abierto Ciudad de Bucaramanga and T4 at the Pacific Colombia Tour Abierto de Barranquilla… After eight starts he went on to finish 33rd on the TLA Order of Merit to earn his card for the inaugural season of PGA TOUR Latinoamérica.

2010: Won the Colombian Tour's Abierto Petrolero at the Club Internacional.
tourBios.personal: Nicknamed “Chucho”… Was introduced to golf as a 14-year old caddie at Bogota's Club La Florida. Then he moved to Club El Rancho y became a pro at the Carmel Club… Hobbies include fishing, movies and soccer… Favorite professional teams are Colombia's Millonarios and England's Chelsea… His favorite book is “Revelations” (or the Apocalypse)… Loves seafood… Usain Bolt is his favorite athlete to watch… Says there is no place like his hometown, Bogota… Favorite quote: “Don't do unto others what you don't want others do unto you.”
tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 6-10 at 2015 Dev Series Final (exempt to midseason reshuffle)

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR Latinoameri was T23rd in 2015 at the Volvo Colombian Classic presentado por Arturo Calle.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T64th in Total Eagles on the Latinoamérica.
